segments.text: I was stuck between 15th and 16th floors in the elevator .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , really ? I know that telephone signal must have been shielded in the elevator shaft , so what did you do then ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I pressed the emergency button ! And then I stayed in the elevator waiting for the rescue .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Did you panic at the time ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: A little bit , but I know that the elevator isn't enclosed . at least I wouldn't be smothered there .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Was there anyone else with you ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Of course , there are 6 other people in the elevator ; they were so scared that someone even started crying .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: So you mean that you were the only brave one there ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes . I have to call the property management .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: For what ? Complaining about what happened in the elevator ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes . They should check the elevator regularly . I have to give them something to remember about , and they should also equip fire extinguishers in the building .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That was just an accident . you are worried too much about it . I think the property management will check the elevator and improve their service from now on .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I know what you mean , but I'd better remind them again , and also remind them to repair the button in the elevator for the disabled people . That has brought the disabled people lots of inconvenience .
segments.speaker: S1
